WRITING.TITLE: Is it normal that kicked ball is never called for the offensive team?

WRITING.TEXT:
I'm a guy with a bubble butt. Also apparently my teeth are very tiny.
Any suggestions for exercises that shed ass weight?
http://i.imgur.com/vVbIiOj.jpg

When you say as a group, do you mean her boyfriend should be included?
I'm by no means interested in the girl in question. We're strictly friends, good ones at that. There have been times where we start off a night as a big group, head out to a bar, her boyfriend (and a few others) leaves early but she stays and still has a good time. Would it still be weird if I set up the plans with her? How about her and another friend or two?
Thank you!
Edit: words

There are a few possibilities I can think of from what I have garnered from your situation.
His parents might still be put off by you. That would be true with a lot of parents. They might *say* they're OK with you, but still bad mouth you when you're not around. It's normal.
Don't take your friend's word for it if he says you're not too clingy. I would never tell my friend he's clingy. Even though I think that 100%, I wouldn't want any hard feelings between us.
If you really think you have nothing to lose, you can just come straight out with it and ask why he never takes the initiative to hang with you.

Can you explain exactly what the conflict/incident was about? It may very well be his parents who are trying to keep a good distance between the two of you.
I feel like a horrible person for it, but I'm on the other end of the situation. I've been friends with this guy for 7 years. The first 4 were amazing. Then (until now), it's always him who tries to set up plans.
Are you too clingy? When you talk to him, do you keep the conversation interesting? Are you a "buzzkill" sometimes? Those 3 are things my friend does on a regular basis. It makes me feel like shit when I turn him down.

WRITING.TITLE: Is it ok to ask a girl to go clubbing/to a bar if she has a boyfriend who's not into those?
WRITING.TEXT:
I'm a guy and I'm very good friends with both of them. He's one of my closest guy friends, and the girl is one of my closest girl friends.
The thing is, I'm the only one in my usual circle of guy friends who likes to go out into the club scene. I know she likes dancing too, so why not ask her? Would there be a problem or is it weird?
Thanks
